learning_objective: Distribute tasks and maintain a project timeline when collaboratively developing computational artifacts.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex and their friends are working on a project to develop a fantasy football application. What steps can they take to ensure that tasks are distributed properly and the project timeline is maintained?",
    "Answer1": "Alex assigns all tasks to themselves to ensure everything is done correctly and on time",
    "Answer2": "Alex and their team distribute tasks according to their skills and interests, and they follow a timeline with clear deadlines",
    "Answer3": "Alex and their team work on tasks as they come up without any specific distribution of roles",
    "Answer4": "Alex assigns the hardest tasks to the strongest team member",
    "CorrectAnswer": "2",
    "Explanation": "To effectively collaborate on a project, tasks should be distributed based on team members' skills and interests. A clear timeline with achievable deadlines also helps to keep the project on track. Working as a team also means recognizing and utilizing everyone's strengths, not overloading certain members with the most complex tasks."
}
